subtitle: Feb 7 - 9 | Austin
title: AnacondaCON
summary:
At AnacondaCON, you will engage with foundational contributors and thought leaders in the Open Data Science movement who are harnessing the power and innovation of our community. The agenda will be filled with educational, informative and thought-provoking sessions to ensure you walk away with the knowledge and connections you need to move your Open Data Science initiatives forward.

Follow us at @ContinuumIO and the #AnacondaCON #AnacondaCREW hashtags for updates!

subtitle: November 15 - 18 | New York City
title: PLOTCON
summary: Sara Bird will present her talk 'Making Data Science Accessible with Visualization' at this year's PLOTCON!

subtitle: November 13 - 18 | Salt Lake City
title: Supercomputing
summary:
High Performance Analytics Team Lead Stan Seibert will present the tutorial 'High Performance Python for Scientific Computing' alongside other presenters from Intel Corporation and Argonne National Laboratory on Sunday, November 13th, from 8:30AM - 5PM. 

Follow @ContinuumIO and #SC16 to stay up-to-date on our activities during the conference!

subtitle: Oct 16 - 20 | Orlando
title: Gartner Symposium/ITxpo
summary:
Come join us in the Emerging Technologies Pavilion & Theater to meet co-founders Travis Oliphant (@teoliphant) and Peter Wang (@pwang), as well as our CMO Michele Chambers (@MCanalytics).

Follow Continuum Analytics on Twitter @ContinuumIO and the #GartnerSYM #AnacondaCrew hashtags to stay up-to-date on all our activity during the conference. See you there!

subtitle: October 7 - 9 | Washington, D.C.
title: PyData DC
summary:
Continuum is the founding sponsor of PyData Conferences, and we’re proud to have a presence at these important open source conferences all over the world. Our team looks forward to seeing our #AnacondaCrew in Washington, D.C. and talking all things Python, data science and open source. 

Follow @ContinuumIO @PyData and the #PyData hashtag for updates!

subtitle: Sep 26 - 29 | New York City
title: Strata + Hadoop World New York
summary:
Join the #AnacondaCrew at booth #325 at Strata + Hadoop World in NYC this year! Sarah Bird and Bryan Van de Ven will lead the tutorial 'Interactive Intelligent Apps in Python' on Tuesday, September 27 from 1:30-5PM, and CTO & co-founder Peter Wang will present his talk 'Building an Enterprise Data Science Environment with Anaconda, Hadoop, Spark,' on Wednesday, September 28, from 4:35-5:15PM. 

Want to join us at Strata NYC? Register now with the code Continuum20 for 20% off!

subtitle: September 14 - 16 | Durham
title: PyData Carolinas
summary:
Continuum is the founding sponsor of PyData Conferences, and we’re proud to have a presence at these important open source conferences all over the world. Our team looks forward to seeing our #AnacondaCrew in North Carolina and talking all things Python, data science and open source.

Follow @ContinuumIO @PyData and the #PyData hashtag for updates!

subtitle: August 26 - 28 | Chicago
title: PyData Chicago
summary:
Continuum is the founding sponsor of PyData Conferences, and we’re proud to have a presence at these important open source conferences all over the world. Our team looks forward to seeing our #AnacondaCrew in Chicago and talking all things Python, data science and open source.

Follow @ContinuumIO @PyData and the #PyData hashtag for updates!

subtitle: July 17 - 24 | Bilbao
title: EuroPython
summary:
Bokeh core developer Fabio Pliger will be hosting his talk "OMG, Bokeh is Better Than Ever!" on Thursday, July 21 at 11:15AM at this year's EuroPython Conference. Don't miss it! 

Follow @ContinuumIO @europython and the #EuroPython hashtag for updates!

subtitle: July 12 - 13 | Cambridge
title: MIT CDOIQ Symposium
summary:
CTO and Co-Founder Peter Wang will present 'The ‘D’ in CDO Stands for Disruption, not Data' at the MIT CDOIQ Symposium on Wednesday, July 13 at 4:55PM.

Follow Continuum Analytics on Twitter @ContinuumIO and the #MITCDOIQ #AnacondaCrew hashtags to stay up-to-date on all our activity during the conference. See you there!

subtitle: July 11 - 17 | Austin
title: SciPy
summary:
Continuum Analytics is sponsoring SciPy 2016 in our hometown of Austin, Texas. Come join us at the 15th annual SciPy Conference for Data Science, Python, Open Source and more! 

Stay tuned for more details, as well as information on an offsite Happy Hour with our team. Follow @ContinuumIO and the #SciPy2016 hashtag for updates!

subtitle: June 14 - 15 | Paris
title: PyData Paris
summary:
Continuum is the founding sponsor of PyData Conferences, and we’re proud to have a presence at these important open source conferences all over the world. Our team looks forward to seeing our #AnacondaCrew in Paris and talking all things Python, data science and open source.

Follow @ContinuumIO @PyData and the #PyData hashtag for updates!

subtitle: June 7 | Bloomington
title: MinneAnalytics Big Data Tech
summary:
Kristopher Overholt will present his talk 'Unlocking the True Value of Hadoop with Open Data Science,' and Ian Stokes-Rees will lead a hands-on training of 'Anaconda Python for Data Science' on June 7 at MinneAnalytics. 

Follow Continuum Analytics on Twitter @ContinuumIO and the #BigDataTech #AnacondaCrew hashtags to stay up-to-date on all our activity during the conference. See you there!

subtitle: June 6 - 8 | San Francisco
title: Spark Summit
summary:
Software Developer Siu Kwan Lam and Data Scientist Daniel Rodriguez will present talks at Spark Summit 2016. Siu will discuss GPU Computing with Apache Spark and Python on Tuesday, June 7 at 4:15PM, and Daniel will present Connecting Python to the Spark Ecosystem on Wednesday, June 8 at 11:15AM. 

Follow @ContinuumIO and the #SparkSummit #AnacondaCrew hashtags for event updates!

subtitle: June 3 | Munich
title: Big Techday 9
summary:
Kristopher Overholt will present his talk 'Unlocking the True Value of Big Data with Open Data Science' at 4:15PM on June 3 at Big Techday 9. See his full talk abstract here. 

Follow Continuum Analytics on Twitter @ContinuumIO and the #BigTechday9 #AnacondaCrew hashtags to stay up-to-date on all our activity during the conference. See you there!

subtitle: May 28 - June 5 | Portland
title: PyCon
summary:
Don't miss the tutorial 'PyData 101: Essential Data Science Skills for Every Programmer, From Data to Model to Visualization' from Data Scientist Christine Doig and CTO of Fashion Metric, Andy Terrel on Saturday May 28 at 9AM CST. 

Follow @ContinuumIO and the #PyCon #AnacondaCrew hashtags to stay up-to-date on all our activity during the conference.

subtitle: May 20 - 21 | Berlin
title: PyData Berlin
summary:
Continuum is the founding sponsor of PyData Conferences and we’re proud to have a presence at these important open source conferences all over the world. Our team looks forward to seeing our #AnacondaCrew in Berlin and talking all things Python, data science, and open source.

Follow @ContinuumIO @PyData and the #PyData hashtag for updates!

subtitle: May 20 - 22 | Boston
title: Open Data Science Conference East
summary:
Continuum CTO and Co-Founder Peter Wang will be presenting his talk, 'Interactive Viz of a Billion Points with Bokeh Datashader' and Dask core developer Matt Rocklin will present 'Parallelizing Data Science in Python with Dask' at ODSC Boston this year. 

Follow @ContinuumIO @odsc and the #ODSC hashtag for updates!

subtitle: May 16 - 19 | Austin
title: OSCON
summary:
Data Scientist Christine Doig is hosting ‘Navigating the Data Science Python Ecosystem’ on Thursday, 5/19 in Ballroom B at 4:20PM CST. Come meet the Continuum Analytics team at booth #313 for demos of our powerful open source tools like conda, Bokeh, dask, Blaze and more!

Follow @ContinuumIO and the #OSCON #AnacondaCrew hashtags to stay up-to-date on all our activity during the conference.

subtitle: May 16 - 20 | Florianópolis
title: SciPy Latin America
summary:
Carlos Cordoba, Spyder core developer, presents 'What's New in Spyder 3.0' May 18 at 2:20PM, and Bryan Van de Ven, Bokeh core developer, will discuss 'Interactive Data Visualization in the Browser with Bokeh' May 20 at 9:40AM at this year's SciPy Latin America conference. 

Follow @ContinuumIO @SciPyLA and the #SciPyLA2016 hashtag for updates!

title: Python Tutorial
summary: Official Python beginners' guide for first-time users.

title: Python Reference
summary: Official, detailed, documentation to the whole of the standard python library.

title: Continuum Training Program
summary: Seize the Power of Python for All your Data and Analytic Needs: Continuum Academy courses are designed and taught by Python experts who are core contributors to the Python ecosystem

title: Anaconda Skills Accelerator Program
summary: A professional development residency program that accelerates scientists and engineers into data science careers

title: Introduction to Scientific Computing in Python
summary: Introduction to Scientific Computing in Python

title: Anaconda Package List
summary: Links to documentation for all of the packages installed with or available in Anaconda.

title: Pandas Documentation
summary: Structured data manipulation, particularly tabular. Allows SQL-style operations and a wide range of visualisations.

title: Numpy Documentation
summary: NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python. It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object; sophisticated (broadcasting) functions; tools for integrating C/C++ and Fortran code; useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random number capabilities

title: Scipy Documentation
summary: Scientific routines for python. Many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as routines for numerical integration and optimization.

title: Matplotlib Documentation
summary: The most popular data vidualisation library for python, producing publication-quality 2D and 3D output for a variety of backends.

title: Continuum on Twitter
summary: Collected tweets across a wide range of python and data-science.

title: Planet Scipy
summary: Blogs relating to science and data analysis in the python ecosystem.

title: SciPy Conferences
summary: The annual SciPy Conferences allows participants from academic, commercial, and governmental organizations to: showcase their latest Scientific Python projects; learn from skilled users and developers; and collaborate on code development.

title: Data Science Central
summary: Featured Blog Posts - Data Science Central

title: Continuum Blog
summary: The official blog of Continuum Analytics.

title: Anaconda Forum
summary: For questions relating to the Anaconda Platform in general

title: Stack Overflow: Python
summary: Post questions and mine the knowledge of the best of the open-source community.

title: Conda Forum
summary: For questions about Anaconda's package manager, Conda

title: Bokeh User Guide
summary: Bokeh is a Python interactive visualization library that targets modern web browsers for presentation. Bokeh provides elegant, concise construction of novel graphics with high-performance interactivity over very large or streaming datasets in a quick and easy way.

title: Bokeh Forum
summary: This mailing list is for users (and developers) to ask and answer questions regarding usage of Bokeh, including related projects such as rbokeh, bokeh.jl, and bokeh-scala.

title: Blaze Dev Forum
summary: Questions and answers for people interested in developing Blaze, the multi-backend computation expression engine.

title: Numba Dev Forum
summary: Questions and answers for people interested in developing Numba, the high-performance just-in-time compiler for python.

title: Matplotlib Forum
summary: Discussion, announcements, and development related to using matplotlib

title: NumPy and SciPy Project Mailing Lists
summary: The mailing lists are our primary community forum. This is where we organize projects, announce new releases, plan future directions, and give and receive user support.

title: Numfocus
summary: NumFOCUS is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit that supports and promotes world-class, innovative, open source scientific software.  The mission of NumFOCUS is to promote sustainable high-level programming languages, open code development, and reproducible scientific research. We accomplish this mission through our educational programs and events as well as through fiscal sponsorship of open source data science projects. We aim to increase collaboration and communication within the scientific computing community.

title: Anaconda Cloud Documentation
summary: Anaconda Cloud is a package management service that makes it easy to find, access, store and share public and private notebooks, environments, and conda and PyPI packages, and to keep up with updates made to the packages and environments you're using.  You can build packages using the Anaconda client command line interface (CLI), then manually or automatically upload the packages to Anaconda Cloud to quickly share with others or access yourself from anywhere.

title: Anaconda Documentation
summary: Anaconda is an easy-to-install free package manager, environment manager, Python distribution, and collection of over 720 open source packages offering free community support.

title: Continuum Developer Blog
summary: Keep in touch with the latest technologies and tools coming out of Continuum Analytics.  The nitty gritty about the status and development challenged of your favorite open source Python tools
